text: "Mawtini" (; "My Homeland") is the national anthem of Iraq. The song formerly served as an unofficial anthem of Palestinians and other colonized peoples of the Middle East for much of the 20th century. ==Lyrics== Arabic original Transliteration IPA transcription English translation 1 [mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË] [Ã¦l.dÍ¡Ê’Ã¦.lÃ¦Ë.lÊŠ wÃ¦â€¿l.dÍ¡Ê’Ã¦.mÃ¦Ë.lÊŠ wÃ¦â€¿s.sÃ¦.nÃ¦Ë.Ê”ÊŠ wÃ¦â€¿l.bÃ¦.hÃ¦Ë.Ê”ÊŠ] [fÉªË rÊŠ.bÃ¦Ëk fÉªË rÊŠ.bÃ¦Ëk] [wÃ¦â€¿l.Ä§É‘.jÃ¦Ë.tÊŠ wÃ¦â€¿n.nÃ¦.dÍ¡Ê’Ã¦Ë.tÊŠ wÃ¦â€¿l.hÃ¦.nÃ¦Ë.Ê”ÊŠ wÉ‘â€¿r.rÉ‘.dÍ¡Ê’Ã¦Ë.Ê”ÊŠ] [fiË hÃ¦.wÃ¦Ëk fiË hÃ¦.wÃ¦Ëk] [hÃ¦l Ê”É‘.rÉ‘Ëk hÃ¦l Ê”É‘.rÉ‘Ëk] ğ„† [sÃ¦Ë.li.mÃ¦n mÊŠ.nÉ‘Ê•.Ê•É‘.mÃ¦n wÉ‘ É£Ã¦Ë.ni.mÃ¦n mÊŠ.kÉ‘r.rÉ‘.mÃ¦n] ğ„‡ [hÃ¦l Ê”É‘.rÉ‘Ëk fiË Ê•ÊŠ.lÃ¦Ëk] [tÃ¦b.lÊŠ.É£uâ€¿s.si.mÃ¦Ëk tÃ¦b.lÊŠ.É£uâ€¿s.si.mÃ¦Ëk] [mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË] 2 [mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË] [Ã¦Êƒ.ÊƒÃ¦.bÃ¦Ë.bÊŠ lÃ¦n jÃ¦.kÉªl.lÃ¦ hÃ¦m.mÊŠ.hu Ê”Ã¦n jÃ¦s.tÉ‘.qÉªl.lÃ¦] [Ê”É‘w jÃ¦.biËd Ê”É‘w jÃ¦.biËd] [nÃ¦s.tÉ‘.qÉªË mi.nÃ¦â€¿r.rÉ‘.dÃ¦Ë wÉ‘ lÃ¦n nÃ¦.kuË.nÃ¦ lÉªâ€¿l.Ê•Éª.dÃ¦ËÊ”] [kÃ¦Ëâ€¿l.Ê•É‘.biËd kÃ¦Ëâ€¿l.Ê•É‘.biËd] [lÃ¦Ë nÊŠ.riËd lÃ¦Ë nÊŠ.riËd] ğ„† [Ã°ÊŠl.lÃ¦.nÃ¦Ëâ€¿l.mu.Ê”Ã¦b.bÃ¦.dÃ¦ wÉ‘ Ê•É‘j.ÊƒÃ¦.nÃ¦Ëâ€¿l.mÊŠ.nÃ¦k.kÃ¦.dÃ¦Ë] ğ„‡ [lÃ¦Ë nÊŠ.riËd bÃ¦Ël nÊŠ.Ê•iËd] [mÃ¦dÍ¡Ê’.dÃ¦.nÃ¦Ëâ€¿t.tÃ¦.liËd mÃ¦dÍ¡Ê’.dÃ¦.nÃ¦Ëâ€¿t.tÃ¦.liËd] [mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË] 3 [mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË] [Ã¦l.Ä§ÊŠ.sÃ¦Ë.mÊŠ wÃ¦â€¿l.jÉ‘.rÉ‘Ë.Ê•ÊŠ lÃ¦Ëâ€¿l.kÃ¦.lÃ¦Ë.mÊŠ wÃ¦â€¿n.ni.zÉ‘Ë.Ê•ÊŠ] [rÉ‘m.zÊŠ.nÃ¦Ë rÉ‘m.zÊŠ.nÃ¦Ë] [mÃ¦dÍ¡Ê’.dÊŠ.nÃ¦Ë wÉ‘ Ê•É‘h.dÊŠ.nÃ¦Ë wÉ‘ wÃ¦Ë.dÍ¡Ê’i.bÊŠn mi.nÃ¦â€¿l.wÉ‘.fÃ¦ËÊ”] [jÃ¦.hÊŠz.zÊŠ.nÃ¦Ë jÃ¦.hÊŠz.zÊŠ.nÃ¦Ë] [Ê•Éªz.zÊŠn.nÃ¦Ë Ê•Éªz.zÊŠn.nÃ¦Ë] ğ„† [É£É‘Ë.jÃ¦.tÊŠn tÊŠ.ÊƒÉ‘r.rÉª.fu wÉ‘ rÉ‘Ë.jÃ¦.tÊŠn tÊŠ.rÉ‘f.rÉª.fÊŠ] ğ„‡ [jÃ¦Ë hÃ¦.nÃ¦Ëk fiË Ê•ÊŠ.lÃ¦Ëk] [qÉ‘Ë.hÉª.rÉ‘n Ê•Éª.dÃ¦Ëk qÉ‘Ë.hÉª.rÉ‘n Ê•Éª.dÃ¦Ëk] [mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË mÉ‘w.tË¤Éª.niË] I My homeland, my homeland, Glory and beauty, sublimity and splendour Are in your hills, are in your hills. Life and deliverance, pleasure and hope Are in your air, are in your air. Will I see you, will I see you? ğ„† Safely comforted and victoriously honoired. ğ„‡ Will I see you in your eminence? Reaching to the stars, reaching to the stars My homeland, my homeland. II My homeland, my homeland, The youth will not tire, their goal is your independence Or they die, or they die. We will drink from death, and will not be to our enemies Like slaves, like slaves. We do not want, we do not want ğ„† An eternal humiliation, nor a miserable life. ğ„‡ We do not want, but we will bring back Our storied glory, our storied glory. My homeland, my homeland. III My homeland, my homeland, The sword and the pen, not the talk nor the quarrel Are our symbols, are our symbols. Our glory and our covenant, and a faithful duty Moves us, moves us. Our glory, our glory, ğ„† Is an honourable cause, and a waving flag. ğ„‡ O, behold you, in your eminence, Victorious over your enemies, victorious over your enemies. My homeland, my homeland! ==References== Category:Asian anthems Category:Iraqi culture
title: Mawtini
